meanings.definition: Playful or mischievous in a cheerful way.
meanings.sent1: The children were feeling larky as they played in the park.
meanings.sent2: Her larky personality always brightened up the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat's larky behavior of chasing its tail never failed to make us smile.
meanings.sent4: His larky sense of humor was like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The larky puppy's antics were a joy to watch.

meanings.definition: Full of high spirits or fun.
meanings.sent1: The party was larky with laughter and music filling the air.
meanings.sent2: The children's faces lit up with larky excitement when they saw the presents.
meanings.sent3: The larky atmosphere at the carnival made everyone forget their worries.
meanings.sent4: Her larky energy was contagious, spreading joy to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The larky celebration continued late into the night.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or inclined to engage in harmless pranks or jokes.
meanings.sent1: The larky group of friends enjoyed playing practical jokes on each other.
meanings.sent2: His larky nature often led to hilarious moments during family gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The larky siblings decided to fill the house with balloons as a prank.
meanings.sent4: Their larky banter kept the mood light and cheerful throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The larky office culture made workdays more enjoyable.
